website_summaries.verdict: While it's not as versatile as traditional rakes, its sturdy design and user-friendly features make it a good choice for detailed and intricate tasks.
pros: Long vinyl grip covers the lightweight aluminum handle and prevents slipping
Tines have a bowed design and 8-inch spread - ideal for tough debris and tight spaces
cons: The 54-inch handle may seem a bit short for taller users
Strange placement of product sticker (across the tines) is difficult to remove

customer_reviews.title: A really fine rake, with one silly flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to rake up tons of twigs that have fallen from trees in my back yard. It's got just the right amount of pull - a perfect size and high quality build. I'm very happy with the rake and expect to have it for years to come. Maybe by then, I'll finally get the glue off the tines. Really, they could have found a better way to attach the label. It was heavily glued to the tines - no way to pull it off. Such a silly annoyance for an otherwise great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Guither

customer_reviews.title: Very small.  Tip on how to remove the label.
customer_reviews.text: Meaning to post this tip on HOW TO REMOVE THE ANNOYING LABLE. Use hair dryer to warm the label before trying to remove it. It only takes 10 seconds or so and soon it peels right off without leaving any trace of glue or paper. This photo shows how small this rake really is and my hand is a small hand. Hoping this thing works good raking leaves from V-shaped area on my roof. It is light enough so holding up wouldn't be a problem. Will update review after trying it this weekend. Raked around a small tree and it worked very well. Raised from 3-stars to 4-stars.
customer_reviews.author: Baba

customer_reviews.title: Quality rake at a value price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace an old plastic shrub rake that had a shorter wooden handle. The longer handle and stiffer head on this one makes it a dream to use. It looks like a quality build, and should last for many years. The handle is of heavy gauge aluminum (no splintering!), with a plastic hand grip coating and the head is well-painted spring steel. For those complaining about the labels, just soak them in WD-40 or paint thinner, cover tightly with a plastic bag, leave overnight, and the labels will peel off cleanly. WD-40 also has the benefit of leaving a rust-preventive coating.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fix-it

customer_reviews.title: Label Came Off Easily - Great Little Rake
customer_reviews.text: I simply took my time and peeled the label off SLOWLY. My patience was rewarded by the possession of a superior garden product. Nothing I could find in my local hardware or big box stores provided a similar level of features and/or quality of manufacture. The design and materials are perfect for this kind of tool. The tines are strong enough to be durable, flexible enough to be effective and protected with a thick powder coat. The handle is lightweight and fast handling, and although some foam on the handle might have been nice, the powder coating on the top half of the handle is not slick and easy to grip.
customer_reviews.author: An Adventure Sportsman

customer_reviews.title: If I had known, I would not have purchased it.
customer_reviews.text: The rake comes with a large label almost completely covering the tines. You can see the remains of this label in the first customer supplied photo. Prepare to spend 15 minutes to half an hour removing the label. The adhesive is strong so the paper pulls apart in pieces. As the label covers most of the functional area of the rake, it must be removed. You will need a solvent that will dissolve the adhesive without removing the paint. Clearly, the people who make and distribute this rake are aware of this and, apparently, don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Vince_49

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: We use these to scoop alpaca poop, but I've found myself using them for SO MANY OTHER THINGS! Rearranging the shavings in the chicken coop, whacking the chickens (gently) out of the way, raking leaves from amidst schrubbery -- Vait! Dat isss not how yooo schpell schrubbery?? Darn! I hate it when my fingers have a German Accent! I could keep going on the list of ways I use these rakes, but I need to go re-educate my fingers.
customer_reviews.author: The Profane Mom

customer_reviews.title: The logo sticker
customer_reviews.text: The logo sticker is very difficult to remove. I spent 45 minutes removing it, and then had to remove the remaining adhesive with lacquer thinner. Very frustrating. It would have taken me 20 minutes to remove the dead leaves from under some bushes. It's actually an excellent product; very well made, and does an excellent job. I'm sorry I bought it, but if you have an hour to kill and some lacquer thinner, and you have a larger job by all means you can't go wrong with this rake.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W Gordinier

customer_reviews.title: Works great for it's purpose
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a number of hardwood trees and azalea shrubs on my property. Every Fall the leaves accumulate both on the shrubs and on the ground around the shrubs. This rake works extremely well in getting the leaves out from the leaves on the ground around the shrubs; it works fairly well getting the leaves out that are stuck in the shrubs. Even though it's still a time to consuming process to get those leaves out, the rake makes it much easier than doing it by hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Joel Mason

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: These are very light and length is great. Just not sturdy at all. Took this out the box and it was already vent. And it’s smaller than I expected which I was not happy. Just like others said, it was very hard to peel the stickers off of the rake. I took my time and did it nice and slow but still could not peel that off completely.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery, light weight, and extremely sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my elderly mother who loves gardening. I was delighted at how fast she received the Corona RK 62060 8” Fixed Tine Shrub Rake, the product arrived way ahead of the estimated date. Upon opening the box I found the rake to be Light weight and extremely sturdy. The width is perfect for using in small spaces (flower beds, between vegetables, etc.) and the 53” handle should make it easy on a persons back.
customer_reviews.author: Chab

customer_reviews.title: Little But Mighty rake!
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis and it is hard to use a regular rake due to the weight and size. I saw this online and gave it a try and it is really great to use. If it's in between my plants easily in my flower bed. It has lightweight metal rakes so it still has the sturdiness and strength to rake up my flower bed debris. I especially like that it is easy to store it doesn't take up a lot of room.
customer_reviews.author: J Mc

customer_reviews.title: Flashy looking but ...
customer_reviews.text: The over the claws has a VERY HARD to remove adhesive....and hinders the claw flexibility if not tediously removed As a gardening tool a metal handle, even coated, is un-functionality eventually roasting. Wood would and still is the right choice. The handle is 8 to 10 in. to long for best control.......
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I can’t recommend this it broke after the first use
customer_reviews.author: Kz

customer_reviews.title: Great rake for gardeners with mulch beds!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little rake! I am a gardener and replace my mulch every year and this really made th job easier. The reason is that the handle is a lot longer than many rakes and there is more weight in the head which helps you not exert so much energy and get into places (like behind your box trees) without having to bend over too much! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: lizzz

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: GREAT, GREAT, GREAT! I was tentative about buying this because of some reviews describing poor quality and durability but I’m glad I bought this. Mine has proven quite durable and sturdy. I use mine to rake up horse manure in my pastures (works so much better than manure forks with long grass!).
customer_reviews.author: Cleaning Machine

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic rake to scoop poop!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this rake as a pooper scooper rake! Our last one had a wooden handle and rotted over time! This one is fantastic and is great quality! I waited to write the review just to see how durable it was. SEVERAL months later and it's still holding strong. The only downfall is the length--the handle is VERY long, however it works so I cant really complain. 4 stars only because I wish the handle was shorter.
customer_reviews.author: farmgirl_20

customer_reviews.title: Updated 12/2019 the smaller size comes in handy
customer_reviews.text: very well made. metal and wood construction materials. tines are sturdier than most i've seen. the handle is quite long. enough length to get to hard to reach spots. priced exceptionally well compared to others that aren't nearly as good of quality. having a smaller sized rake like this makes yard chores much easier. it has held up well over the past couple of years with no issues. i would recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: MikenzCO

customer_reviews.title: Nice handle
customer_reviews.text: Has a great handle. The rack teeth, however, are not made of spring steel so they bend and stay there. Another thing you will not like is the big label that is stuck to the head, impossible to get it all off.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Biswanger

customer_reviews.title: Very nice rake, except for label
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, sturdy little rake. However, they slapped a huge label over the tines, which I had to soak to at least get it partially removed. Now there is sticky residue all over the tines. I will have to work to remove that, too, so that dirt and leaves don't adhere to it. Otherwise great rake, I'm sure it will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: AMYL

customer_reviews.title: sturdy device
customer_reviews.text: Like the length and the sturdiness of the tines. A real job helper when doing yard work around the house. This is not a flimsy product like some sold in stores. You won't be disappointed in buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Makes the job easier and more efficient.
customer_reviews.text: I love this rake especially the long handle. It’s very sturdy. Makes the job easier, faster and more efficient. I’m in a manual wheelchair and do all my own yard work, so I like tools that extend my reach. I’m sure it will last for years, but would buy again. Great gift for those who garden or do yard work.
customer_reviews.author: butitsadryheat

customer_reviews.title: Rake you very much!
customer_reviews.text: Really strong rake. When you get the bigger rakes, a lot of times they get flimsy just because of sheer size and cumbersome to work with. Since this ones a little smaller than an average rake, I'm glad to give that size for more strength and durability, in terms of low odds of issues such as prong bending
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Like the product; LOVED the delivery!
customer_reviews.text: I think this was my FIRST Amazon delivery service delivery! Love that they put a picture of the item ON my porch! The rake is perfect for my needs. THANKS..........might need to go back and order the other two designs of the rakes. This was the small one for working around smaller planting and shrubs! Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Tiny rake
customer_reviews.text: Knew I was buying a smaller rake, but didn’t realize it was a child’s toy. Says the rake is 8” across, but when measured it barely hits 7”. Buy something else unless you plan on using it in a small flower bed.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, lightweight and durable as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to rake up 6 months of dog poop on my yard. It was sturdy and lightweight as advertised. I didn't get blisters on my hands even though I didn't wear gloves and raked 40x50 feet yard. As other reviewers mentioned, it would be nice if the company would use a different type of glue so that the label is not stuck to the tines.
customer_reviews.author: Elizaangelo

customer_reviews.title: Poor Manufacturing Choices
customer_reviews.text: After 5 minutes of picking at the label I am led to caution others to save their money. An otherwise decent product has been ruined by the poor choice of packaging. As small of a detail as it is, the manufacturer’s choice to attach the label with such a poor adhesive actually ruined the product in my view. I am not wasting the time, energy, or fossil fuels necessary to return this item, but I would like others to know my experience before buying. Attached is a picture of what I was able to accomplish before I got frustrated enough to walk away and write this review.
customer_reviews.author: AMBARISTA

customer_reviews.title: Gets in tight spots
customer_reviews.text: I really like the small form factor of this rake and it seems pretty sturdy and I hope it will last for years. Just keep it inside a garage or shed and don't let moisture sit on it. I would recommend to anyone needing a small garden rake.
customer_reviews.author: Fredster

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Unfinished End on Metal Handle
customer_reviews.text: The 8' head of the rake seems to be well made. The handle is light and appears to be sturdy. Unfortunately, the handle, which is made from aluminum had a sharp unfinished end, Not sure if it was missing an end piece, but the sharp end is dangerous. Also, there is no customer service contact provided, so the only choice is to keep a potentially dangerous tool or send it back and have to have them send a new rake. I would have preferred just to have them send me an end piece.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: I'm 66 young and picking up the dog poo in the backyard has become a labor of un-love. This little rake allows me, along with a shovel to pick up without the bending over, saving my young back. It makes my life much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I really am starting to be wary of Amazon's choices. This rake is terrible, the prongs are flimsy and don't do much at all. It is lightweight, maybe good for raking a few leaves but not dirt. I kept it because I needed to use it asap but otherwise it would have gone right back.
customer_reviews.author: Firstsnow

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Owned a small medal rake for years and have been looking for a new one. The only ones I could find were plastic. I found this on Amazon, it was delivered and absolutely what I wanted. It is a great product and made in the USA, which is even better.
customer_reviews.author: chindi

customer_reviews.title: Why Would You Do That?
customer_reviews.text: Great Rake - look, feel, function ... but it immediately loses 1 star for gluing the label to the tines. Why would you do that? What a dumb thing to do! So dumb, in fact, that I'm docking another overall star right now because I'm still working on getting it off the tines, two days later.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bailey

customer_reviews.title: This shrub rake is well made. The tines are ...
customer_reviews.text: This shrub rake is well made. The tines are flexible but have not broken working in heavy ground cover with lots of buried leaves. The spaces between tines are narrow enough to captures small branches & twigs. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: MKK

customer_reviews.title: Corona RK 62060 Fixed Tine Shrub Rake works just fine for me!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly! My only problem was getting it out of the plastic wrapping it was in AND getting the sticker off both sides of the rake. It was almost like you guys didn't want me to get the rake out of the packaging. Please put the label on the plastic and not on the rake itself. It took a while to get it off!!!! But it does work fine!!! Would have given 5 stars if not for the packaging!!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna D Satterlee

customer_reviews.title: This rake is made for hard work.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through several rakes of this size and they always brake, I purchased this rake and have put it to work. I plan to buy other items from them now.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to garden tool collection
customer_reviews.text: The rake is a nice size to get under shrubs and to spread mulch around existing plants. It has a nice long handle that works for me @ 5'5" and my husband @ 6'2". The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because the tines on the rake could be a bit more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Becky B

customer_reviews.title: Quite good
customer_reviews.text: Now, keep in mind- I'm using this in Phoenix, AZ. for pickup mostly bougoinvillea, leaf and just drift. It's been great for that- it came well packaged and seems (so far) to be built plenty sturdy enough to withstand the brutal sun and heat, here.
customer_reviews.author: AZWarmer

customer_reviews.title: Small....
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was getting a full sized rake.. maybe I missed something but it is very small. It is long but the head is tiny. It is strong but not what I looking for, about 1/4 the size of a normal rake head.
customer_reviews.author: Ami Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Good tool at good price.
customer_reviews.text: To get the label off easily with no residue left, heat it with a heat gun or even a hairdryer on high. Once the adhesive softens it peels off easily and cleanly. Very nice stiff rake, looks well made. Does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Rottiegirl

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Right Size
customer_reviews.text: This rake will be perfect for smaller jobs, such as getting cuttings off bushes after they are pruned. It will also be great in small areas. It's just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Loves to Shop

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny. It does not bend and is really strong. It has a long stick so I didn’t have to do much bending which was great for my back. It is also easy to carry not heavy at all. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Buy it works great
customer_reviews.text: I am a short senior citizen who can't get in the back of my flower bed This works perfect. Looks well made very happy with my new gardening tool.
customer_reviews.author: LYNNE CRONIN

customer_reviews.title: This rake is just what I needed to clean the leaves out of the shell garden beds in my courtyard.
customer_reviews.text: This small rake is a good size to clean up the two shell garden beds in my courtyard. It was easy to use and sturdy enough for the job. It wouldn't be large enough for a large yard, but it's perfect for small areas like flower beds, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Just ok...
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special. It is lightweight, yes, and the handle is longer than most rakes. However, I wish the handle could be adjusted. The packaging was over the top, huge box. A product information sticker covered most of the tines. Had to soak the tines and use Goo Gone to get it off completely.
customer_reviews.author: Isabella2012

customer_reviews.title: Poor Packaging
customer_reviews.text: The rake seems to be made sturdy, unfortunately the packaging, most likely from Amazon, was not proper. I received this damaged, bent. I saw this issue as I read the reviews before ordering, but hoped for the best. Well, we;ll try to re-order.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Garden Tool!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rake - great for getting leaves out from under shrubs. I've shopped around for a tool like this, and this is the first I've found that's so well-made, lightweight, and has an extra-long handle. The customer service provided by this company is exceptional as well. I'm very happy with the purchase, and will check out other yard tools made by this company.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Works well for cramped spaces
customer_reviews.text: Says it’s 8 in but mine was only 7 1/4. But it seems to still do the job of cleaning out small spaces and even larger ones of leaves and acorns. Even tilted to fit in 2 in wide areas it works.
customer_reviews.author: fiddler

customer_reviews.title: exactly like pic
customer_reviews.text: The rake was delivered in a very large box to protect it, which it did. Perfect for getting between bushes without going into the bushes.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Light and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I thought the bottom of the rake was a little wider, but it serves the purpose of taking up things from wood chips, leaves, sticks and poo.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Ba

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read some reviews about the label so, I didn’t even bother trying to remove it, besides it works just as well with it on! I had a hard time reaching the back row of my garden until I got these.
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: This rake is perfect for getting between the plants in my flower beds
customer_reviews.text: This rake is perfect for getting between the plants in my flower beds. I use it to even the mulch out when I am adding new mulch around my plants. I like that it isn't so wide that it catches on my plants and pulls them our or tears the leaves. This is a very handy tool. I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Superior to any other shrub rakes.
customer_reviews.text: Used to rake and collect pieces of Hickory nuts. Gathering whole Hickory nuts is easy. What makes it difficult is squirrels chew the nuts while in the trees and the pieces drop like rain to the ground. Tines on Fiskers rakes break quickly. These Corona rakes are much better all around
customer_reviews.author: Mwb2

customer_reviews.title: Well-Made Fixed Tine Shrub Rake
customer_reviews.text: At 8 inches, it's made to fit where a traditional rake will not fit. It's well made, and it is made with high-quality materials. It's very lightweight too with an aluminum handle. I like it and I would recommend it to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A. DUARTE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for digging rubbish out under shrubs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for digging rubbish out under shrubs, sturdy and well made. However the box this came in gave my kids Christmas flashbacks cause it was so gigantic. Wish amazon would Be more earth conscious and stop the excessive wrapping.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: It was a good size for cleaning off leaves and debris over flower gardens without disturbing new plants underneath. Liked so well bought a second one for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to get in the tight spots, lightweight but strong!
customer_reviews.text: This is very well made and fantastic for getting into small areas and for quick jobs. Love the extra long handle to get between the plants. Also very handy for people with less strength since it is lightweight (but does the job!).
customer_reviews.author: Amazonfan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rake
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for! Too bad they put label on rake sticky and everything stick to it
customer_reviews.author: Ducky

customer_reviews.title: Corona for all your gardening needs
customer_reviews.text: An avid gardener here and you can not beat any of the Corona products. I use the bigger rake and this one to get in the smaller spots. In addition, I use their trimming scissors exclusively. If they dull, just sharpen them. The only way to break them is to loose them in a leaf pile.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann King

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little rake.
customer_reviews.text: The handle on this is to die for. I'm 5'9" and it comes up to my cheek bone. Meaning great to get well under the trees and the short ones where you can not see very well. It's, so far, sturdy enough however I do not need it for heavy work just leaves and it works just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tool
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting into the nooks and crannies in your garden or landscaping. Will see how durable it is as I have only owned it about 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: JimC

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: My NEW. Favorite rake. Well made, handles the heavy stuff. I was afraid it was going to be flimsy but it is good and heavy for my work.
customer_reviews.author: Chrise

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rake. I have a side yard with many small stones in it and needed a way to rake them out. This works perfectly. Tines are tough and the width is just right.
customer_reviews.author: Techpro

customer_reviews.title: Just the right size
customer_reviews.text: This rake is just the right size for getting deep into shrub beds and pulling out debris--lightweight and strong at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret King

customer_reviews.title: Great for all gardeners!!
customer_reviews.text: I am 87 years old, and found this little gem easy to use and great for working in our community garden AND perfect for use in my 20' x 40' rooftop garden. Great price for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Querencia

customer_reviews.title: Great yard rake for flower beds
customer_reviews.text: Best yard tool I’ve bought in a while. Love how it gets in between bushes and flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Beachwalker

customer_reviews.title: Great for Working Around Bushes
customer_reviews.text: this is a good brand. It makes racking under bushes much easier than the big unit
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: I love this little rake
customer_reviews.text: I love this little rake. its easy to go under bushes and between flowers or in a vegetable garden. Its real sturdy and the tines are stiff and don't bent, it is what I wanted and what I needed. Very handy little rake. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: My old rake broke and this one seems to be nicely built, won't really be using until spring. I'm happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: So Handy!
customer_reviews.text: I use this mini rake a lot with the debris dustpan. Super for yard clean up!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy little rake. I like it because it's not as wide as a standard rake and I can get in between my pots. To remove the label, heat it up with a hair dryer. I didn't pull it off from the front, instead I pushed it back through the tines (sticky side facing me). Comes right off!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This rake eats them overpriced plastic jobs at the big box store for breakfast! Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Well made! This is the best brush rake I've ever used! Thank you other reviewers for leaving an honest review. This rake will last you a long time, it's awesome!
customer_reviews.author: sandra w.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Corona Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Corona quality and very fair price too! MINOR IRRITATION:Took time scrapping of the product sales pitch though. Had to finish it with paint thinner...
customer_reviews.author: James R. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Nice rake but...
customer_reviews.text: The sticker that covers the tines is a permanent part of the rake apparently
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Shrub Rake
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and weight of the product Will enjoy using it for lawn work
customer_reviews.author: K.M.. Habersky

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little rake to get into the spaces between my plants. I use it to pull small weeds up, too. Seems pretty sturdy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly E. Niemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Serves its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Well made, light weight yet rugged, and comfortable to use. Serves its purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for hard to reach areas and easily handled with ...
customer_reviews.text: Note that the 8 inch head is not a joke ... it's really 8 inches. It's perfect for hard to reach areas and easily handled with one hand, just perfect. I love this rake. Never saw one in a store like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Chang

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Love this lightweight little rake to clean out my chicken coop. It gets in the hard to reach/maneuver places due to the small size.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Love this little rake. Perfect for getting in between shrubs.
customer_reviews.author: Helen L.

customer_reviews.title: fits drain
customer_reviews.text: could not find in lowes or homeboy depot cept plastic
customer_reviews.author: tom smith

customer_reviews.title: The best rake ever built.
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, we have purchased many rakes of this size. We used to have llamas and used the rake to clean up their manure. This rake is simply the BEST shrub rake on the market. It holds up GREAT, light weight and does not bend or break as all our past rakes have. We used to have to replace our rakes about every month or so. Have used this one for nearly a year and it is still as GOOD as NEW. If you need a shrub rake, this is the one to buy. It is now months later after our purchase. We still believe this rake is the BEST rake on the market.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to give this to my grandson to use as part of his gardening toys, that’s exactly what it looks and feels like, a toy. I can’t use it for my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Love this rake, patching a lot of small areas in our lawn. Some are only about 6 inches across. this tool you can rake up the soil and plant your seed and your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: B VanEmon

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, well made, long handle to reach under shrubs.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to use, like the long handle getting under shrubs. Lawn guys use Corona brand, glad I asked what brand they liked.
customer_reviews.author: CAT

customer_reviews.title: Light use only , small handle
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, that this rake I ordered is not good enough for my lawn to remove the straw on my grass. May work well for light use.
customer_reviews.author: Aswin Garimalla

customer_reviews.title: Need sturdy narrow rake
customer_reviews.text: I needed a narrow sturdy rake to get to tight places in my vegetable garden . This is great for that.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Forester

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog poop rake
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to rake dog poop in the back yard. So far seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Old Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: The handle seems to be a little longer than necessary ...
customer_reviews.text: The handle seems to be a little longer than necessary, but other than that it works perfectly. And I had absolutely no problem taking the label off...as some reviewers have complained about.
customer_reviews.author: JBPENCO

customer_reviews.title: It's lightweight, flexible but sturdy enough to handle tight places in your garden.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the rake. The first time I used it, you could tell it was sturdy but very flexible. It effortlessly worked in the hard to reach areas of my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Armando Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Well made rake!
customer_reviews.text: We use this with our gravel (southwest landscape). We use it with the label attached.
customer_reviews.author: roweazmike

customer_reviews.title: decent rake
customer_reviews.text: The rake itself is a good rake. It's small, so perfect for raking under shrubs. It is light weight but the handle is no stronger than a kitchen broom.
customer_reviews.author: shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Needed this type of rack for leveling cedar mulch. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: John Austin

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting into narrow spaces without having to bend ...
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting into narrow spaces without having to bend over, but I hate the large sticker on the tines which is not removable, or let's say, it would take forever as it breaks off into teeny pieces when trying to remove, and another long sticker on the handle, totally unnecessary these stickers.
customer_reviews.author: xxxxxxxxxxxx

customer_reviews.title: Very small rake
customer_reviews.text: Rake is way too small. Its like a toddler sized version of what a rake should be. Cheaper is not always better.
customer_reviews.author: Char

customer_reviews.title: I use this inside.
customer_reviews.text: I use this small rake to clean up my child's room. I get it all in one spot then throw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Small but useful
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to use for my small little plot of mulch outside my house. A little smaller than I expected but works well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very light and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Very light and flexible, excellent for light to medium yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: lovely except for sticker
customer_reviews.text: doesn't the picture say it all? It's lovely, metal and light. Tag it instead of a sticker.
customer_reviews.author: Desert Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great handle and kength
customer_reviews.text: I like weight and long handle but it needs to have stronger teeth to do the job right.
customer_reviews.author: Moon

customer_reviews.title: Great rake!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The previous reviews do not lie. I really like this rake!! Easy to use for different tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Sutton

product_meta.title: Corona RK 62060 Fixed Tine Shrub Rake, Aluminum Handle, 8-Inch Wide
product_meta.description:
Founded in the early 1920s, Corona is a leader in the marketing and manufacturing of professional and consumer tools for the lawn and garden, landscape, irrigation, construction and agriculture markets. With a retail and distribution network that extends throughout the United States and Canada, Corona’s proven designs, quality manufacturing processes and unparalleled customer service make it the best choice in tools for contractors, agricultural professionals and avid gardeners alike.

AMAZON.COM
The Corona Clipper 8-inch/11-fixed-tine shrub rake is made of tempered steel and lightweight aluminum for long-lasting durability. The rake's 11 extra-wide tines apply light pressure to remove debris without damaging plant feeder roots, while its bi-curved bow gives even pressure to all tines for maximum raking efficiency. For added convenience, its narrow head makes it easy to rake between closely spaced plants. Plus, the tool's 54-inch lightweight aluminum handle with anti-slip vinyl sleeve allows for gripping comfort in both extreme heat and cold weather.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Founded in the early 1920s, Corona Clipper, Inc. is a leader in the marketing and manufacturing of professional and consumer tools for the lawn and garden, landscape, irrigation, construction and agriculture markets. With a retail and distribution network that extends throughout the United States and Canada, Corona's proven designs, quality manufacturing processes and unparalleled customer service make it the best choice in tools for contractors, agricultural professionals and avid gardeners alike. Corona is the brand to trust for high quality landscape tools for the homeowner. Our products feature comfortable grips and innovative designs to make your gardening work easier. You can count on Corona to have the right tool for your outdoor project. Only Corona puts professional-grade quality into every tool we make. That's why nearly all of our products carry a lifetime warranty ensuring you'll have years of reliable service.

See more
feature_bullets: QUICK CLEANUP: An ideal tool to quickly and easily rake up clippings, leaves, and other lawn and garden debris
EFFICIENT: Bi-curved bow gives even pressure to all tines for maximum raking efficiency
NO DAMAGE: 11 extra-wide tines remove debris without damaging plant feeder roots
COMFORTABLE TO USE: Lightweight aluminum handle with anti-slip vinyl sleeve
